sen.j: 山脇 東洋（やまわき とうよう、宝永2年12月18日 (旧暦)（1706年2月1日）- 宝暦12年8月8日 (旧暦)（1762年9月25日））は、江戸時代の医学者。
sen.e: Toyo YAMAWAKI (February 1, 1706 - September 25, 1762) was a medical scientist who lived in the Edo period.
Toyo YAMAWAKI (February 1, 1706 - September 25, 1762) was a medical scientist in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 場所がなく時代のみなので、who livedは不要と考えられるため、削除しました。
sen.e: Toyo YAMAWAKI (February 1, 1706 - September 25, 1762) was a medical scientist in the Edo period.

sen.j: 実験医学先駆者の一人。
sen.e: He was one of the pioneers in experimental medicine.
He was one of the pioneers in experimental medicine.
He was one of the pioneers in experimental medicine.

sen.j: 東洋は後の号で、はじめは移山。
sen.e: Toyo was the name he started to use later in his life, and he called himself Izan first.
Toyo was the name he started to use later in his life; he called himself Izan before that.
sen.cmt: ・firstが不適切と考えられるため、変更しました。・原文通りの語順で訳す場合、andでつなげない方がいいかと思い、変更しました。
sen.e: Toyo was the name he started to use later in his life; he called himself Izan before that.

sen.j: 名は尚徳、字は玄飛、子飛。
sen.e: His real name was Hisanori, and his nicknames were Genhi and Shihi.
sen.cmt: 尚徳→Hisanori (読み方不明) 玄飛→Genhi (読み方不明)子飛→子樹ではないかと思いましたが、原文のまま「Shihi (読み方不明)」と訳出しました
sen.e: His real first name was Hisanori, and his nicknames were Genhi and Shihi.
sen.cmt: 念のため、「名」を「（名字でないほうの）名前」としておきました。
sen.e: His real first name was Hisanori, and his nicknames were Genhi and Shihi.

sen.j: 子に山脇東門、門下に永富独嘯庵らがいる。
sen.e: His son was Tomon YAMAWAKI and his disciple was Dokshoan NAGATOMI.
His son was Tomon YAMAWAKI, and one of his students was Dokushoan NAGATOMI.
sen.cmt: ・discipleではニュアンスが異なるように思いますので、studentを使用しました。・原文から門下生が複数いたことがわかるので、それに沿ってより自然な表現に変更しました。・Dokshoanにuを加えました（ku）。
sen.e: His son was Tomon YAMAWAKI, and one of his students was Dokushoan NAGATOMI.

sen.j: 丹波国亀山に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Kameyama in Tanba Province.
He was born in Kameyama in Tanba Province.
He was born in Kameyama in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 医家清水家の生まれで、享保11年（1726年）に父が門下の法眼山脇家の養子となる。
sen.e: His family, the Shimizu family, was a doctor family, and in 1726, his father became an adopted son of the hogen of the YAMAWAKI family that he was studying under.
He was born to a doctor family, the Shimizu family, and in 1726, he was adopted into the hogen of the Yamawaki family, whom his father was studying under.
sen.cmt: ・訳文では「父が養子になった」となっていましたが、原文から「本人が養子になった」と解釈できると思われるので、そうしました。・原文の「～家」を尊重して訳出しつつ、familyが多いので、ひとつ減らしました。・用語統一リストに従い、姓のみで登場する「山脇」を、最初の文字のみ大文字にしました。
sen.e: He was born to a doctor family, the Shimizu family, and in 1726, he was adopted into the hogen of the Yamawaki family, whom his father was studying under.

sen.j: 1729年には家督を相続して法眼となる。
sen.e: In 1729, he took over the family and became the hogen.
In 1729, he took over the family and became the hogen.
In 1729, he took over the family and became the hogen.

sen.j: 後藤昆山から、理論よりも実践を重視する古方派を学び、延享3年（1746）には唐代の医学書『外台秘要方』を復刻。
sen.e: He learned from Konzan GOTO the school of kohoha medicine which put more importance on practice than theories, and in 1746, he reprinted a medical book written during the period of the Tang Dynasty called "Gedaihiyoho."

He learned from Konzan GOTO in the school of Kohoha medicine which put more importance on practice than theories, and in 1746, he reprinted a medical book originally written in the Tang dynasty called "Gedaihiyoho."
sen.cmt: ・learned the schoolという言い方はしないように思いますので、「古方派の後藤昆山」から学んだ」としました。・昔の本の復刻ということが明確になるよう、念のためoriginally writtenとしました。・Konzanの読みは広辞苑で確認しました。・「唐代」を簡潔化しました。
sen.e: He learned from Konzan GOTO in the school of Kohoha medicine which put more importance on practice than theories, and in 1746, he reprinted a medical book originally written in the Tang dynasty called "Gedaihiyoho."

sen.j: カワウソの解剖から陰陽五行説に基づく人体の内景に疑問を抱き、1754年(宝暦４年)閏２月、京都所司代の許可を得て死刑囚の解剖、観察を行う。
sen.e: He questioned a human anatomical chart created based on the ommyo-gogyo-setsu when he dissected an otter; therefore, with permission of the Kyoto shoshidai (governor general), he dissected and observed the body of an executed criminal in 1754.

He questioned the human anatomical chart created based on the Inyo-gogyo-setsu (the China-origin doctrine that everything in the universe is made of five basic elements, and has two opposite aspects) when he dissected an otter; therefore, he dissected and observed the body of an executed criminal in March 1754 with permission of the Kyoto shoshidai (governor general).
sen.cmt: ・「人体解剖図」の冠詞をtheに変更しました。・「陰陽」の読みをInyoとしました。・「陰陽五行説」に簡単な説明を加えました。・「許可を得て」の部分が後に来るほうが意味が取りやすいため、そうしました。・「閏２月」は、用語統一リストに従って、下記のサイトでグレゴリオ暦に換算し、「３月」としました。
sen.e: He questioned the human anatomical chart created based on the Inyo-gogyo-setsu (the China-origin doctrine that everything in the universe is made of five basic elements, and has two opposite aspects) when he dissected an otter; therefore, he dissected and observed the body of an executed criminal in March 1754 with permission of the Kyoto shoshidai (governor general).

sen.j: 宝暦9年（1759年）にはその成果を解剖図録『蔵志』として刊行。
sen.e: In 1759, he published his observation as an anatomical book called "Zoshi."
In 1759, he published his observations as an illustrated anatomical book called "Zoshi."
sen.cmt: ・observationは複数形が自然と思われるので、そうしました。・「図録」の部分を訳出しました。
sen.e: In 1759, he published his observations as an illustrated anatomical book called "Zoshi."

sen.j: 漢方医による五臓六腑説など、身体機能認識の誤謬を指摘した。
sen.e: In the book, he pointed out fallacies in the understanding of physiological functions that had been established in ommyo-gogyo-setsu by Chinese medicine doctors.
In the book, he called fallacious understandings of bodily functions such as Gozo-roppu-setsu developed by Chinese medicine doctors.
In the book, he pointed out fallacious understandings of bodily functions such as Gozo-roppu-setsu developed by Chinese medicine doctors.

sen.j: 吉益東洞ら古医方においても人体解剖には抵抗が強かったため批判を浴びるが、国内初の人体解剖は蘭書の正確性を証明し、医学界に大きな影響を与える。
sen.e: The book received much criticism because doctors had strong hesitation to dissect a human body in koiho (school of ancient medicine) led by Todo YOSHIMASU, but the first human body dissection in Japan proved the accuracy of Dutch literature giving a strong impact on the field of medicine.

The book received much criticism because doctors had strong hesitation to dissect a human body in koiho (school of ancient medicine) led by Todo YOSHIMASU, but the first human body dissection in Japan proved the accuracy of the Dutch medical literature, giving a strong impact on the medicine community.
sen.cmt: ・「蘭書」の訳にmedicalを追加しました。・givingの前にコンマを加えました。・「医学界」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: The book received much criticism because doctors had strong hesitation to dissect a human body in koiho (school of ancient medicine) led by Todo YOSHIMASU, but the first human body dissection in Japan proved the accuracy of the Dutch medical literature, giving a strong impact on the medicine community.

sen.j: 東洋の影響を受け、江戸では杉田玄白、前野良沢らがより正確性の高いオランダ医学書の翻訳に着手する。
sen.e: Inspired by Toyo, in Edo, Genpaku SUGITA and Ryotaku MAENO started to translate a Dutch medical book having higher accuracy.
Inspired by Toyo, in the city of Edo, Genpaku SUGITA, Ryotaku MAENO and others started to translate a Dutch medical book with higher accuracy.
sen.cmt: ・「江戸」が場所であることが明確になるようthe city ofを追加しました。・「ら」を訳出しました。・havingをwithに変更しました。
sen.e: Inspired by Toyo, in the city of Edo, Genpaku SUGITA, Ryotaku MAENO and others started to translate a Dutch medical book with higher accuracy.

sen.j: 日本の医学の近代化に大きく貢献した人物である。
sen.e: Therefore, Toyo greatly contributed to modernization of Japanese medicine.
Thus, Toyo greatly contributed to the modernization of Japanese medicine.
sen.cmt: ・ThereforeをThusに変更しました。・modernizationにtheを付けました。
sen.e: Thus, Toyo greatly contributed to the modernization of Japanese medicine.
